title: Does Math Make Matter? SU(3) Gluons, Dirac‚Äôs Positron & Banach‚ÄìTarski | Late-Night Philosophy Salon
description:
üåô Pull up a chair and join my late-night salon...

I‚Äôm winding down and thinking out loud about Eugene Wigner‚Äôs ‚Äúunreasonable effectiveness of mathematics.‚Äù 

We drift from Ramanujan‚Äôs intuition and Banach‚ÄìTarski weirdness to gauge symmetries (why U(1) ‚Üí photon, SU(3) ‚Üí 8 gluons), Dirac‚Äôs equation ‚Üí positron, and detours through Tegmark, Wolfram, and Penrose. I also pitch an evolutionary angle: maybe our brains like consistency because it kept us alive.

Is math‚Äôs spooky accuracy in physics actually surprising‚Ä¶ or exactly what you‚Äôd expect in a consistent universe? Leave your take‚ÄîI‚Äôll read them with my bedtime tea. ‚òïüêà 

Pour yourself something warm, get comfortable as we meander around these topics in this relaxed salon:

üîÆ Why do abstract mathematical symbols predict real particles?
üóø Are we discovering math or inventing it?
ü™ê Is reality itself mathematical, or is that just how we see it?
üïâÔ∏è Intuition vs. symbol-pushing (Ramanujan's divine dreams)
üé≠ Banach-Tarski & the Axiom of Choice (getting two from one)
üé≤ Wigner's puzzle: prediction beyond description
‚ú® Dirac's equation ‚Üí positron discovery
üåÄ Gauge symmetry: U(1) ‚Üî photon; SU(3) ‚Üî 8 gluons
üß¨ Fields, generators, and "are particles just symmetries?"
üéØ Should we be surprised? Selection bias & survivorship
üèõÔ∏è Tegmark, Wolfram, Penrose‚Äîcompeting philosophies
üß† Evolution, beauty, and why consistency feels right


If you‚Äôre new here:
I‚Äôm Lisha Li, founder/CEO of Rosebud AI. After hours I intend on hosting lo-fi salons on philosophy, physics and math‚Äîwith occasional cat appearances.

Sweet dreams and deeper questions,
Lisha

Hashtags:
#LateNightSalon #Wigner #PhilosophyOfMath #PhilosophyOfPhysics #GaugeTheory #Dirac #Ramanujan #BanachTarski #StandardModel #SU3 #Higgs #Tegmark #Wolfram #Penrose #TwistorTheory #Tegmark #Wolfram #ComputationalUniverse #EvolutionaryCognition #MathPredictsPhysics #ChatGPT #ScienceYouTube #LateNightSalon #PhilosophyOfMath #PhilosophyOfPhysics #Math #Physics #Wigner #UnreasonableEffectiveness #GaugeTheory #Dirac #Ramanujan #BanachTarski #AxiomOfChoice #StandardModel #SU3 #Higgs

title: $300M for AI Scientist? The ChatGPT Moment for Materials Science
description:
One of ChatGPT's creators just raised $300 million at a $1B+to valuation to build an army of robot scientists. This isn't hype‚Äîit's AI's leap from bits to atoms.

In this video, I break down why I invested in Periodic Labs and why their autonomous labs could unlock room-temperature superconductors and materials we've only dreamed of. Led by Liam Fedus (one of the creators of ChatGPT at OpenAI) and Ekin Dogus Cubuk (who led materials science and chemistry at DeepMind), they're solving this fundamental problem: while language models learned from trillions of tokens on the internet, the physical world lacks that data.

They're building robotic labs that run experiments 1000x faster than humans, generating the data needed to train AI for materials discovery. Plus, they're developing AI systems to synthesize decades of existing research to guide what experiments to run next.
 
We dive into investor Slater Stich's breakdown of why this is the moment for this company‚Äîfrom the talent bringing together creators of attention mechanisms and GPT with world-class chemists, to what it actually takes to build labs that can synthesize thousands of materials per day. This is what happens when AI leaders from OpenAI and DeepMind team up to tackle the physical world. Slater also happens to be my husband but that's not why I'm recommending his blog post, it genuinely is so insightful. As I go on to explain in the video. 

Blog post referenced: https://baincapitalventures.com/insight/we-must-know-we-will-know/
Learn more about Periodic Labs: https://periodic.com/


#AIforScience #PeriodicLabs #MaterialsScience #OpenAI #DeepMind #ChatGPT #AutonomousLabs #Superconductors #VentureCapital #StartupFunding #SeedRound #TechInvesting #ScientificDiscovery #Robotics #MachineLearning #AIRevolution #MaterialsDiscovery #PhysicalAI #DeepLearning #TechStartup #Innovation #FutureOfScience #AIResearch #LabAutomation #Chemistry #Physics #AI #Technology #Science #Startup #Investment #Future

title: Yang-Mills Part 1: AI teaches me Differential Geometry for the $1M Mass Gap Millennium Problem
description:
Work with me through the mathematical machinery needed to understand the Yang-Mills millennium problem with ChatGPT (and sometimes Grok). Starting with minimal differential geometry knowledge, I build up to gauge theories through oriented manifolds, Lie groups, fiber bundles, and G-valued forms.

This is unscripted learning in real-time. Hopefully this can encourage more people to use frontier models to learn topics they are interested in. Part 2 will continue into the Yang-Mills equations and explore how deep learning methods might contribute to solving this $1 million problem.

Topics covered:

üåÄ Oriented n-manifolds and why the M√∂bius strip fails orientation
üåÄ Tangent spaces and basis choices on S¬≤
üåÄ Lie groups (SO(3), U(1)) as continuous symmetries
üåÄ G-valued k-forms on compact manifolds
üåÄ Fiber bundles as "private spaces" attached to each point
üåÄ The connection 1-form Œ© and how it measures gauge field changes
üåÄ Curvature as drift when parallel transporting around loops
üåÄ The Dirac monopole on S¬≤ as a concrete gauge theory example
üåÄ Why the monopole requires two coordinate patches
üåÄ Beginning Yang-Mills: from U(1) to SU(2) non-abelian gauge theory


#YangMills #MillenniumProblems #GaugeTheory #DifferentialGeometry #LieGroups #FiberBundles #Grok #AILearning #MathematicalPhysics #Manifolds #ConnectionForms #DiracMonopole #NonAbelianGaugeTheory #LearningWithAI #RealTimeLearning

title: Navier Stokes: How Terence Tao's Program Can Guide AI Reasoning Models to the $1M Solution
description:
I chat with Grok & ChatGPT to dive deep into the Navier-Stokes Millennium Prize Problem. Starting from scratch with minimal PDE knowledge, I explore how these fundamental fluid dynamics equations emerged from classical mechanics, why they're so difficult to solve, and Terry Tao's program that might lead to a solution. I then spend a lot of time discussing how AI and in particular reasoning models can deliver us a solution. 

We cover:

üåä The physics behind Navier-Stokes equations and their derivation from Newton's laws
üåä Why turbulent flows create mathematical singularities
üåä The $1 million Millennium Prize challenge: proving whether smooth flows stay smooth forever
üåä Terry Tao's energy cascade approach to bounding potential blow-ups
üåä How modern AI and deep learning could help crack this 180-year-old problem

This video was the first video I created using AI for interactive learning (second that I posted) while exploring how AI itself might contribute to solving one of mathematics' greatest challenges. Perfect for anyone curious about advanced mathematics, fluid dynamics, or the intersection of AI reasoning models and mathematical research.

00:00:41 - What Navier‚ÄìStokes is & why it matters
00:03:15 - Global smoothness (regularity) framing
00:03:24 - Why turbulent flows can create singularities
00:11:54 - Energy cascade idea (toward bounding blow-ups)
00:13:05 - Deriving Navier‚ÄìStokes from Newton‚Äôs second law
00:21:00 - ‚ÄúDo smooth flows stay smooth forever?‚Äù (core question)
00:28:56 - How deep learning could help crack it
00:34:57 - Conditional regularity results
00:35:32 - Proving regularity via reduced equations
00:39:29 - Datasets & limits; pattern discovery
00:40:10 - Tao‚Äôs program for Navier‚ÄìStokes
00:41:56 - Deep learning can search over vast spaces
00:43:48 - Training signals for reasoning agents (PDEs)
00:46:04 - Reasoning-agent strategy to make progress


#Mathematics #NavierStokes #MillenniumPrize #DeepLearning #FluidDynamics #TerryTao #MathematicalPhysics #AILearning #reasoningmodels

title: AI explains the Riemann Hypothesis: Why this $1M Problem Links Primes 2 Quantum Physics & Langlands
description:
I used ChatGPT (gpt5) and Grok to help me understand the Riemann Hypothesis - arguably mathematics' most important unsolved problem. What started as trying to understand prime distribution turned into a brief foray into quantum physics, random matrix theory, and the Langlands program.

The conversation gets into:
- How zeros of the zeta function control the "wiggles" in prime counting
- How zero spacing matches quantum energy levels in nuclear physics
- Why physicists think there's a "prime number Hamiltonian" out there (but can't find it)
- How the Langlands program might crack this through automorphic forms

What I liked: Grok handled my pushback when explanations got too hand-wavy. The AI was genuinely helpful for navigating between different mathematical areas and motivating what's interesting there.

Next time I'm adding a blackboard - this really needs visuals.

Part of exploring how AI can help with learning different subjects. 

00:01 - What is the Riemann zeta function?
00:04 - Connecting zeta to prime numbers
00:06 - The Riemann Hypothesis explained
00:08 - How zeros shape the "wiggles" in prime distribution
00:11 - Zero spacing and connections to quantum physics
00:14 - Random matrix theory and nuclear energy levels
00:18 - The search for a "prime number Hamiltonian"
00:22 - The Langlands program and automorphic forms
00:28 - Wrapping up: primes, physics, and the future


#RiemannHypothesis #PrimeNumbers #QuantumPhysics #GrokAI #Mathematics #LanglandsProgram #NumberTheory #MillenniumPrizeProblem #AILearning #MathEducation #RandomMatrixTheory #QuantumChaos

title: Humans of AI  Our thoughts, voices, image and video are all dreamed up by AI.
description:
Humans of AI is an art project I did over the summer using the GPT3 beta and free tools available by Rosebud (www.tokkingheads.com, www.rosebud.ai).  Humans of AI showcases virtual beings dreamed up by GANs and their stories by GPT3. The project uses GPT3 to synthesize relatable and emotionally rich monologues that characterize the Humans of NY series. ¬†It was important to give the characters a visual representation. ¬†Still somewhat in the uncanny valley, the project was created with tools that generate the text, images, videos and voice with tools freely available by Rosebud AI. This showcases how easy generative media has made certain story telling processes. ¬†

The characters and their stories were curated to be diverse and to challenge stereotypes. Human curation, choice and intent is so important as it is our responsibility to guide a positive and constructive vision for storytelling with these tools and platforms.  AI is a tool in our desire for expression and connection, but at this point, the human in the loop is what‚Äôs essential to create art.  This is an evolving relationship. 

We invite the spectator to participate in the project.  You can generating a character that does not exist and animate them with tokkingheads. ¬†As an experiment in collaborative fiction, what stories do you want to tell?

Learn more at www.rosebud.ai .

title: Generative Photos Demo
description:
Video demo of www.rosebud.ai . We're sharing a collection of 25k HiRes stock photos with customizable AI-synthesized people.  Find the collection at app.generative.photos.

For this collection we focused on increasing diversity in model appearance. Reach out if you want us to create a unique model for your visuals.

Generative.photos is a first step in our synthetic stock photo and API offering, which will eventually allow users to edit and fully synthesize visual content with an intuitive interface. We focused on bringing forth a way to diversify stock photo content since it was a need we heard voiced by stock photo users. All the faces in our 25k photo collection are not of real people.

You can use this collection to serve up dynamic ads catered to individual users, and even give your consumers the power to choose an advertising model that they can relate too. We‚Äôre excited to hear about more uses cases for this platform and collection and look forward to releasing more functionalities for control and synthesis.

The processing of this collection was completely automated, so there may be corner cases, and we‚Äôre happy to hear feedback to continue to improve it.

title: Janet Li Hart House Festival of Dance
description: This was one of the performances I choreographed and performed for the Hart House Festival of Dance (March 2009).  The choreography after the climax was very much a improvised.  I felt it was more authentic to the music as a result.  The music is a piece played on the Chinese instrument called a Pipa.  It is called the Dance of the Yi People--the Yi people are a minority group in China.
